mainEntity.name: What are the fundamental principles of blockchain?

acceptedAnswer.text: Blockchain is a decentralized ledger technology that ensures data integrity through a secure and transparent means, eliminating central authority. For more details, you can refer to Investopedia's [explanation](https://www.investopedia.com/terms/b/blockchain.asp).

mainEntity.name: How does blockchain impact financial services?

acceptedAnswer.text: Blockchain technology enhances security, reduces costs, and increases efficiency in financial services. Deloitte's [report](https://www2.deloitte.com/content/dam/Deloitte/us/Documents/financial-services/us-fsi-blockchain-in-financial-services.pdf) provides a comprehensive look into these benefits.

mainEntity.name: What are the applications of blockchain in finance?

acceptedAnswer.text: Blockchain is leveraged in finance for cryptocurrencies, smart contracts, and identity verification, among others. Explore these applications in depth in PwC's [publication](https://www.pwc.com/gr/en/publications/blockchain-in-financial-services.pdf).

mainEntity.name: What are the challenges and considerations regarding blockchain in finance?

acceptedAnswer.text: Scalability and regulatory issues are among the key challenges in implementing blockchain in finance. The World Economic Forum's [whitepaper](https://www.weforum.org/whitepapers/the-future-of-financial-infrastructure-an-ambitious-look-at-how-blockchain-can-reshape-financial-services) discusses these challenges extensively.

mainEntity.name: What is the future outlook for blockchain in finance?

acceptedAnswer.text: The future of blockchain in finance looks promising, with potential for widespread adoption and innovation. McKinsey's insights on [blockchain in finance](https://www.mckinsey.com/industries/financial-services/our-insights/blockchain-in-finance-what-is-next) explore what's next.
